episodeTitle: Ace and Luffy! Hot Emotions and Brotherly Bonds!
description: Ace battles Smoker while the Straw Hat Pirates flee to the Going Merry. Luffy gets separated from his crew and reunites with his brother Ace. After arm-wrestling and bonding, they are attacked by Baroque Works' Billions agents seeking to capture Ace for promotion. Ace demonstrates his incredible fire powers by destroying five enemy ships before the brothers escape.

events.title: Ace vs Smoker Battle Begins
events.description: While the Straw Hat crew flees from Smoker and the Marines, Ace engages Captain Smoker in combat to cover their escape. This marks the first time viewers see Ace in direct combat against a Marine officer.
events.significance: Demonstrates Ace's willingness to protect Luffy and his crew, establishing his role as a protective older brother. Also showcases the power dynamic between Devil Fruit users.

events.title: Straw Hats Flee to Going Merry
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates successfully reach the Going Merry after fleeing from Smoker. They realize Luffy is not with them, having been separated during their escape.
events.significance: Sets up Luffy's reunion with Ace and creates tension as the crew worries about their captain.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: The crew realizes Luffy didn't follow them to the ship

events.title: Mr. Mellow and Geronimo Debut
events.description: Mr. Mellow and Geronimo, members of the Baroque Works Billions, appear aboard Smoker's ship. They execute Mr. 11, who was captured by Smoker, to prevent him from revealing information about Baroque Works.
events.significance: Shows the ruthless nature of Baroque Works and how they eliminate potential security risks. Introduces two Billions agents who will later attempt to capture Ace.

quotes.text: We are candidates to be promoted to Officer Agents. We can't let Mr. 11 spill our secrets.
quotes.speaker: Mr. Mellow
quotes.context: Explaining why they must kill Mr. 11

events.title: Mr. 11 Killed by Billions
events.description: Mr. Mellow and other Billions members shoot and kill Mr. 11 while he is tied to the mast of Smoker's ship, preventing him from revealing Baroque Works secrets to the Marines.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Baroque Works prioritizes secrecy above all else, even the lives of their own agents.

events.title: Luffy and Ace Reunion and Arm Wrestling
events.description: After being separated from his crew, Luffy reunites with Ace. The brothers engage in an arm-wrestling contest on a barrel, discovering they are perfectly matched in strength. This moment showcases their close bond and competitive brotherly relationship.
events.significance: This is the first extended interaction between Luffy and Ace shown in the anime, establishing their relationship dynamics and equal footing despite Ace being older and more experienced.

quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Challenging Luffy to an arm-wrestling match

events.title: Billions Attack Ace and Luffy
events.description: Mr. Mellow, Geronimo, and other Baroque Works Billions agents surround Ace and Luffy in Nanohana. The Billions hope to capture Fire Fist Ace to earn promotion to Officer Agents within Baroque Works.
events.significance: Shows that Ace's reputation as a powerful pirate precedes him, and demonstrates how Baroque Works agents are ambitious and willing to take on dangerous targets for advancement.

quotes.text: If we take down Fire Fist Ace, we'll surely be promoted to Officer Agents!
quotes.speaker: Geronimo
quotes.context: Motivating the Billions to attack Ace

events.title: Geronimo Defeated by Ace and Luffy
events.description: Geronimo attacks Luffy with a sword, but Luffy evades all strikes. Ace grabs the heated sword with his bare hand, using his fire powers to superheat it, then Luffy finishes Geronimo with a Gomu Gomu no Bazooka, sending him flying.
events.significance: First demonstration of Ace and Luffy fighting together as a team, showcasing their combat synergy and how their abilities complement each other.

events.title: Ace's Hiken Destroys Five Ships
events.description: As Ace and Luffy attempt to escape on a small boat, five Billions ships pursue them. Ace propels their boat with flames, jumps over one ship, and launches his signature Hiken (Fire Fist) attack, completely destroying all five ships consecutively in a massive display of power.
events.significance: This is the first full demonstration of Ace's signature technique and devastating power level in the anime. Establishes why he's called 'Fire Fist Ace' and why he has such a fearsome reputation.

quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Launching his Fire Fist attack to destroy the Billions ships

events.title: Ace Proposes Joining Whitebeard Pirates
events.description: In an anime-original placement of this scene, Ace suggests to Luffy that the Straw Hat Pirates should join the Whitebeard Pirates. Luffy immediately refuses, stating he wants to compete for the title of Pirate King himself.
events.significance: Reinforces Luffy's unwavering determination to become Pirate King on his own terms, and introduces the concept of the Whitebeard Pirates as a major pirate crew. This scene occurs later in the manga (on the Going Merry) but was moved here for the anime.

quotes.text: I'm going to be King of the Pirates! I won't join anyone else's crew!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Refusing Ace's offer to join Whitebeard

events.title: Ace Mentions Blackbeard Hunt
events.description: Ace reveals to Luffy and the crew that he is hunting for a man named Blackbeard, a former member of the Whitebeard Pirates who killed one of Ace's crewmates, Thatch, and fled.
events.significance: This is an extremely important piece of foreshadowing that sets up the events leading to the Summit War of Marineford. Blackbeard will become one of the series' most important antagonists.

quotes.text: I'm tracking down a man named Blackbeard. He was one of us, but he killed a crewmate and ran.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Explaining his mission to hunt Blackbeard

events.title: Brothers Celebrate Together
events.description: The episode concludes with Ace joining the Straw Hat crew aboard the Going Merry for food and celebration. The crew enjoys Ace's company and learns more about Luffy's past.
events.significance: This peaceful moment of brotherhood and camaraderie serves as a calm before the storm, making Ace's eventual fate more emotionally impactful. It's one of the few times Luffy can relax and enjoy time with his brother.

quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Destroying five Billions ships with his Fire Fist attack

quotes.text: I'm going to be King of the Pirates! I won't join anyone else's crew!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Refusing Ace's offer to join the Whitebeard Pirates

quotes.text: I'm tracking down a man named Blackbeard. He was one of us, but he killed a crewmate and ran.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Explaining his mission to the Straw Hats

quotes.text: If we take down Fire Fist Ace, we'll surely be promoted to Officer Agents!
quotes.speaker: Geronimo
quotes.context: Motivating the Billions to attack Ace

themes.description: The episode focuses heavily on the deep bond between Luffy and Ace, showing their playful competition, mutual respect, and willingness to fight together.
themes.symbolism: The arm-wrestling scene symbolizes their equal standing despite age difference, while Ace's protection shows the older brother dynamic.

themes.description: Luffy's refusal to join the Whitebeard Pirates reinforces his unwavering determination to achieve his own dream of becoming Pirate King.
themes.symbolism: Each brother pursues their own path - Luffy seeking the One Piece, Ace hunting Blackbeard.

themes.description: Ace's overwhelming display of power against the Billions establishes why he's a feared pirate commander and explains why capturing him would be such a prize.
themes.symbolism: The destruction of five ships with one attack demonstrates the vast gap between Officer Agents and Billions.

characterSpotlights.development: Ace is shown as a powerful, caring older brother who looks out for Luffy while pursuing his own mission to avenge his crewmate Thatch by hunting Blackbeard.

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire sequence of Luffy getting separated from the crew and fighting the Billions with Ace is anime-original. In the manga, Ace simply helps them escape and boards the Going Merry.
Ace's invitation for the Straw Hats to join Whitebeard occurs in Nanohana in the anime, but in the manga it happens on the Going Merry in front of the whole crew.
The scene with Mr. Mellow and Geronimo killing Mr. 11 is anime-original, adding more depth to the Baroque Works organization.
The extended arm-wrestling scene between Ace and Luffy is expanded in the anime from a brief moment in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time the ending theme 'Fish' by The Kaleidoscope is used in the series.
Episode 95 originally aired as part of a special alongside episodes of Sazae-san, Chibi Maruko-chan, and Kochikame on January 6, 2002.
Voice actor Ginzō Matsuo, who voiced Smoker in this episode, passed away on August 25, 2001, before this episode aired. Mahito Ōba would take over the role starting with Episode 94.
The Hiken technique shown in this episode is Ace's signature move and the source of his epithet 'Fire Fist Ace'. It's powerful enough to destroy multiple ships in one attack.
